title: 110_s2812
content: The Medicare Telehealth Improvement Act of 2008, also known as the Act, increases the types of originating sites and expands the practitioners eligible to provide telehealth services. It also improves the process for updating the list of telehealth services. The Act expands the types of originating sites for telehealth services, including skilled nursing facilities, renal dialysis facilities, mental health centers, and other sites with a telecommunications system. It also eliminates facility fees for certain originating sites. The Social Security Act is amended to eliminate facility fees for certain originating sites for telehealth services. The changes will apply to services provided 90 days after the enactment of the Act. Expansion of practitioners eligible to furnish telehealth services. Expansion of practitioners eligible to furnish telehealth services under Section 1834(m) of the Social Security Act includes physical therapists, occupational therapists, speech-language pathologists, audiologists, and certified providers. Expansion of practitioners eligible to furnish telehealth services under Section 1834(m) of the Social Security Act includes physical therapists, occupational therapists, speech-language pathologists, audiologists, certified providers, and other individuals or entities deemed appropriate by the Secretary. The amendments made by this section will apply to services provided 90 days after the enactment of this Act. The text chunk discusses the improvement of the process for updating the list of telehealth services. The Telehealth Advisory Committee will provide recommendations to the Secretary on adding or deleting services and HCPCS codes. If the Secretary does not implement a recommendation, they must publish a statement in the Federal Register explaining why. The Telehealth Advisory Committee, appointed by the Secretary, consists of 7 members including practicing physicians and non-physician healthcare providers. They make recommendations on services and HCPCS codes for authorized payment under the Social Security Act. The Telehealth Advisory Committee, appointed by the Secretary, consists of members with experience in telemedicine or telehealth services, representing various specialties and regions. Members serve terms specified by the Secretary. The Telehealth Advisory Committee members serve terms specified by the Secretary, meet twice per year, and operate independently of the Federal Advisory Committee Act. The Secretary can establish the committee despite any limitations on advisory committees.
